medication.name: metformin
medication.moreinfo:
Normal dose: 500-850 mg BID
When CLcr< 50 mL/min: Monitor blood glucose BID to QID with any medication change until stable.

medication.name: sitagliptin
medication.moreinfo:
Normal dose: 25-100mg OD
When CLcr< 50 mL/min: Monitor blood glucose BID to QID with any medication change until stable.

medication.name: glyburide
medication.moreinfo:
Normal dose: 2.5-20mg OD
Gliclazide or Repaglinide preferred secretagogues in kidney disease.

medication.name: empagliflozin
medication.moreinfo:
Normal dose: 10-25mg OD
Use at lower eGFR justified if HF or significant renal or CVD risks present.

medication.name: rosuvastatin
medication.moreinfo:
Normal dose: 5-40mg OD
When CLcr< 50 mL/min: Monitor blood glucose BID to QID with any medication change until stable.

medication.name: digoxin
medication.moreinfo: Normal Maintenance dose: 0.0625 mg to 0.125 mg"

medication.name: spironolactone
medication.moreinfo:
If potassium increases to 5.5 mmol/L, decrease spironolactone dose; if patient is taking some combination of an ACE inhibitor, an ARB, an aldosterone-receptor blocker, discontinue one and recheck potassium.
The dose of spironolactone should not exceed 25 mg daily when used with an ACE inhibitor or ARB; this combination of drugs should be avoided when GFR < 30 mL/min.
Prescribe thiazide or loop diuretics (loop diuretics necessary when estimated GFR is < 30 mL/min.

medication.name: nitrofurantoin
medication.moreinfo: Nitrofurantoin is not effective when CLcr<60 mL/min and risk of toxicity is increased.

medication.name: sulfamethoxazole-trimethoprim
medication.dose: Administer q12-24h or reduce dose by 25%
Administer q18-24h or reduce dose by 50%

medication.name: levofloxacin
medication.dose: Administer 500 mg stat, then 250 mg q24-48h
Administer 500 mg stat, then 250 mg q48h
